alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 5:51AM EST until February 19 at 11:31AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 27.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EST Sunday was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.1 feet on 02/14/2020. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued 9 AM EST.
